Get started

Mauro Lepore

2018-06-21

Source: vignettes/fgeo.Rmd
fgeo.Rmd

Overview

fgeo provides a wide range of tools to analyze forest diversity and dynamics. It installs and loads multiple R packages, functions, and datasets in a single step. (To learn more about the structure of ForestgGEO’s software see this article.)

Functions

Datasets

Get Started

To get started run this:

# install.packages("remotes")
# remotes::install_github("fgeo")
library(fgeo)
#> -- Attaching packages ------------------------------------------------ fgeo 0.0.0.9000 --
#> v bciex           0.0.0.9000     v fgeo.demography 0.0.0.9000
#> v fgeo.abundance  0.0.0.9004     v fgeo.habitat    0.0.0.9006
#> v fgeo.base       0.0.0.9001     v fgeo.map        0.0.0.9204
#> v fgeo.data       0.0.0.9002     v fgeo.tool       0.0.0.9003
#> -- Conflicts -------------------------------------------------------- fgeo_conflicts() --
#> x dplyr::filter()    masks stats::filter()
#> x dplyr::intersect() masks base::intersect()
#> x dplyr::lag()       masks stats::lag()
#> x dplyr::setdiff()   masks base::setdiff()
#> x dplyr::setequal()  masks base::setequal()
#> x dplyr::union()     masks base::union()

(See installation.)
